references: We compare FedDM with four representative iterative model averaging based methods: FedAvgÂ [19], FedProxÂ [34], FedNovaÂ [38], and SCAFFOLDÂ [32]. We summarize the action of the client and the server, together with the transmitted message for all methods in Table 1.

references:
In real-world applications, there are various extreme data distributions among clients. To synthesize such non-i.i.d. partitioning, we consider two more scenarios with Dir10â€‹(0.1)subscriptDir100.1\text{Dir}_{10}(0.1) and Dir10â€‹(0.01)subscriptDir100.01\text{Dir}_{10}(0.01). As mentioned, Î±â†’0â†’ğ›¼0\alpha\rightarrow 0 implies each client holds examples from only one random class. It can be seen in Table 2 that previous methods based on iterative model averaging are insufficient to handle these two challenging scenarios and their performance degrades drastically compared with Dir10â€‹(0.5)subscriptDir100.5\text{Dir}_{10}(0.5).
In contrast, FedDM performs consistently better and more robustly, since distribution matching enables it to approximate the global training objective more accurately.

references: In this section, we provide specific message size under different data partitioning of FedDM. As discussed previously, the message size of all baseline methods are determined on the model size, while the message size varies from different scenarios and ipc values. When there are 101010 clients, we set ipc=10 for MNIST and CIFAR10, and ipc=5 for CIFAR100. We present the results in TableÂ 3. It can be observed that FedDM are more advantageous for unbalanced data partitioning, such as Dir10â€‹(0.1)subscriptDir100.1\text{Dir}_{10}(0.1) and Dir10â€‹(0.01)subscriptDir100.01\text{Dir}_{10}(0.01). For the experiment of Dir50â€‹(0.5)subscriptDir500.5\text{Dir}_{50}(0.5) on CIFAR10 with ConvNet, the message sizes of FedDM and baselines are 3.1Ã—1063.1superscript1063.1\times 10^{6} and 1.6Ã—1071.6superscript1071.6\times 10^{7} respectively, where our method saves about 80%percent8080\% costs per round. Moreover, if the underlying model are changed to ResNet-18 for Dir10â€‹(0.5)subscriptDir100.5\text{Dir}_{10}(0.5), then the number of parameters is about 1.1Ã—1081.1superscript1081.1\times 10^{8}.

references: where we clip the sampled weight to guarantee that â€–wâˆ’wrâ€–2â‰¤Ïsubscriptnormğ‘¤subscriptğ‘¤ğ‘Ÿ2ğœŒ\|w-w_{r}\|_{2}\leq\rho. At the serverâ€™s side, when training the global model, we also clip the weight to the ÏğœŒ\rho-radius ball. We conduct experiments to choose ÏğœŒ\rho from [3,5,10]3510[3,5,10] and present the test accuracy after 202020 communication rounds on CIFAR10 under the default Dir10â€‹(0.5)subscriptDir100.5\text{Dir}_{10}(0.5) setting in Table 4. We find that performance is similar and FedDM is not very sensitive to the choice of ÏğœŒ\rho. Ï=5ğœŒ5\rho=5 performs relatively the best and we hypothesize that too small weight makes the optimization of the global model restricted and too big one adds to the difficulty of learning a surrogate function. Based on results in Table 4, we select Ï=5ğœŒ5\rho=5 for all our experiments.
